intro: Belliopsis bellidiodes, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Belliopsis bellidiodes is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
